p: The maximum adsorption capacity of acid-treated MWCNTs was ca 3800 mg g −1, while that of pristine MWCNTs was ca 175 mg g −1. The adsorption isotherms reach a plateau at q e of 3800 mg g −1 and 150 mg g −1 for the modified and unmodified systems, respectively. The initial concentrations for which the isotherms were recorded were 0.53 mg mL −1 and 0.3 mg mL −1 for the oxidized and unmodified systems, respectively. Interpretation of the results was performed assuming three models of isotherms.
